title: Toshiba’s GE-Style Split Risks Lukewarm Welcome
sub_head: The proposed split could unlock some value, but recalcitrant activist investors may conclude it isn’t nearly enough
body:
Three is better than one. Splitting into three companies seems to be the trendy thing to do for once-mighty industrial icons.
Japanese electronics maker Toshiba said Friday it would break itself up into three companies. That follows a similar announcement from General Electric on Tuesday. The two century-old companies used to be manufacturing pioneers in their countries with businesses spanning disparate sectors. But both have stumbled in recent times. Toshiba, in particular, has been embroiled in one scandal after another over the past few years. A foreign investor revolt led to the ouster of the company’s chairman in June.
